content.description: Stack pads and stand start with triangle like feature on the slab face. Work up and slightly right before heading to the lip/top out. A bit silly, a low entrance might also be possible.
content.location: This is the slab face immediately to the left of the v3 tree arete problem.

content.description: Stand start with right hand on good rail and left crimp. Work up the arete and top out above. Fun warm up, a hard low start (v9?) is also possible.
content.location: This is the left arete of the first boulder you pass in the cluster. Immediately left of the nearby tree.

content.description: Start with left hand side pull and matched right hand heel on low right feature in the roof. Move out to the right arete and work up until your standing on top of the first feature. Transition around the arete and take it to the top.
content.location: Small roof located near the prominent UFO feature of the first area.

content.description: Stand start with left crimp and right undercling. Stand on a glassy foot and work up to a good left pinch before throwing to a rail. Left exit is easy and inviting, right exit is proud and tallish.
content.location: Vertical problem immediately to the right of the tree of the first boulder in this cluster. Obvious undercling and crimp features.

content.description: Start on the obvious side pull at 4 ft. Push out left and up towards the aerie and lip.
content.location: Located on the suspended boulder in First Area. The boulder is between Joey's Problem and Roof Arete Boulders.

content.description: Start with right hand on low horn and matched left hand or low undercling. Move up to slopers, trending up and left to a jug before continuing up to the top.
content.location: One of the first things you walk past in this cluster. This is the arete to the right of the tree.

content.description:
Sit start with right hand jug and left-hand pinch in overhang. Follow seam and features in overhang to the lip then top. Fun.

Placeholder name based on the cigarette butts found at base. Pick up your trash ya’ll
content.location: Behind and slightly uphill of most downstream boulder of the group.

content.description: On the far side of the UFO-like block: grab high thin crimps and campus to an edge over the lip, then mantel. A good laugh.
content.location: Near the middle of the area on the suspended UFO.

content.description: Climb the beautiful tall corner. Begin with a highish sit at a left sidepull and right hand on the arete. Powerful moves low to reach a big rail, then some technical improvisation and a spooky mantel to finish.
content.location: Furthest boulder down canyon in the cluster, facing toward/down the creek

content.description: This is the first cluster of boulders reached when walking south (down the canyon) from the parking area.
